abstract: House Republicans narrowly approve budget that increases military spending, but cuts domestic programs and starts to privatize Medicare; plan is to shrink government spending $5.5 trillion over next ten years.
lead_paragraph: Republicans framed the debate around the imperative to shrink the government’s reach, balance the budget and begin to pay down the federal debt — without raising taxes.

headline.main: Increased Military Spending Wins Out After Dueling Budget Votes in House
headline.print_headline: Increased Military Spending Wins Out After Dueling Budget Votes in House

snippet: Republicans framed the debate around the imperative to shrink the government’s reach, balance the budget and begin to pay down the federal debt — without raising taxes.
